qas.question: What is a rare discipline that Avicenna worked on?
On what subject is one of Avicenna's treatise based on?
What doctrine is some of Avicenna's works based around?
According to some, what was Ibn Sina trying to do regarding his works?
What is an unrare discipline that Avicenna worked on?
On what object is one of Avicenna's treatise based on?
What doctrine is some of Avicenna's works not based around?
According to all, what was Ibn Sina trying to do regarding his works?
According to some, what was Ibn Sina trying not to do regarding his works?

context: Ibn Sīnā wrote at least one treatise on <a0_0><b4_0>alchemy<b4_0/><a0_0/>, but several others have been falsely attributed to him. His Logic, Metaphysics, <a1_0><b5_0>Physics<b5_0/><a1_0/>, and De Caelo, are treatises giving a synoptic view of <a2_0><b6_0>Aristotelian doctrine<a2_0/>,<b6_0/> though Metaphysics demonstrates a significant departure from the brand of Neoplatonism known as Aristotelianism in Ibn Sīnā's world; Arabic philosophers[who?][year needed] have hinted at the idea that Ibn Sīnā was attempting to <a3_0><b7_0><b8_0>"re-Aristotelianise" Muslim philosophy<b8_0/><b7_0/><a3_0/> in its entirety, unlike his predecessors, who accepted the conflation of Platonic, Aristotelian, Neo- and Middle-Platonic works transmitted into the Muslim world.
